com.xtructure.xneat.network.impl
Class NeuralNetworkImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xneat.network.impl.NeuralNetworkImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
NeuralNetwork
public class NeuralNetworkImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements NeuralNetwork

NeuralNetworkImpl implements the NeuralNetwork interface with a concurrent neural network. This implementation is based on FloatFastConcurrentNetwork, found in SharpNEAT 1.04 (April 2nd 2006), Colin Green.

Running the neural network assumes that no neuron is connected to an input neuron (as a source).

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

                         java.util.List<Neuron> neurons,
                         java.util.List<Connection> connections)
Creates a new NeuralNetworkImpl.

Parameters:
genomeId - the XId of the Genome that encoded the new NeuralNetwork
biasNeuronCount - the number of NodeType.BIAS Neurons
inputNeuronCount - the number of NodeType.INPUT Neurons
outputNeuronCount - the number of NodeType.OUTPUT Neurons
hiddenNeuronCount - the number of NodeType.HIDDEN Neurons
neurons - the list of neurons in the new NeuralNetwork
connections - the list of Connection in the new NeuralNetwork

relaxNetwork

public boolean relaxNetwork(int maxSteps,
                            double maxDelta)
Description copied from interface: NeuralNetwork
Propagates the energies through the network until the network reaches equilibrium or for the given number of steps. (Equilibrium is reached when the total change in energy with the network is less then the given maxDelta. A single step allows each neuron processes its input energies once.) The returned boolean indicates whether the network reached equilibrium before the maxSteps.

Specified by:
relaxNetwork in interface NeuralNetwork
Parameters:
maxSteps - the max steps
maxDelta - the max delta
Returns:
true if the network reach equilibrium within maxSteps, false otherwise.
